TopicTitle: (Suggestion) Kerbals move on their own on colonies

Articles.Content:
In KSP if you built a colony Kerbals would either stay quiet and inmobile in their homes or they stand like rocks on EVA In my opinion in KSP2 you should be able to establish a zone in wich kerbals can move freely and do different things when they aren't researching or doing something for example: engineers will go around and do animations of repairing parts (though they aren't doing anything  it's just an animation) and tourist may throw parties. Maybe Kerbals encounter each other and talk a bit .
What I want to say is that this will make colonies feel a lot more alive

We have seen in one of the show and tells multiple kerbals running between an exterior launchpad and the VAB. Maybe we shouldn't read too much into that but it's at least plausible that this kind of autonomous activity around colonies could happen. I'd love to see it.
I'd like to see that as well...
i dont find this unlikely. but maybe it will be mostly inside buildings and work much like the kerbals in the vab. but it would be cool if they where outside too
I really hope that Kerbals can walk inside the colony building,  as well as space ships.

10 hours ago, Coo said:

I really hope that Kerbals can walk inside the colony building,  as well as space ships.

Ships would be a bit harder to implement, due to the whole zero-g thing, but I think it may be possible.
Maybe Kerbals could talk to each other?
Maybe something like Fallout Shelter where you're able to manage Kerbals, assign them jobs, watch them, and [DELETED].

There have been Kerbals running around the colony parts for most of their colony-related show and tells, so I wouldn't write it off. Of course, those could just be placed there specifically for that test scene, etc., etc., but it seems plausible!
